-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command '$ifw_api_command$'

-Path.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckUNCPath_String_Path$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckUNCPath_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-User.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckUNCPath_String_User$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-DisplayAlias.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckUNCPath_String_DisplayAlias$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

7.description: The password to authenticate the given user for. Has to be a secure string
7.caption: Password

5.description: The path to a volume or network share you want to monitor, like "\\example.com\Home" or "C:\ClusterSharedVolume\Volume1"
5.caption: Path

12.description:
A warning threshold for the shares total free space in byte units, like "50GB:"
Please note that this value is decreasing over time, therefor you will have to use the plugin handler and add ":" at the end
of your input to check for "current value < threshold" like in the previous example

Allowed units: B, KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB, PiB
12.caption: CriticalTotal

10.description:
A critical threshold for the shares free space in either % or byte units, like "20%:" or "50GB:"
Please note that this value is decreasing over time, therefor you will have to use the plugin handler and add ":" at the end
of your input to check for "current value < threshold" like in the previous example

Allowed units: %, B, KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB, PiB
10.caption: Critical

2.description: Defines with which Execution Policy the PowerShell is started
2.caption: PowerShell Execution Policy

8.description:
Modifies the plugin output to not display the value provided within the `-Path` argument but to use this string value
instead of shorten the output and make it more visual appealing.
8.caption: DisplayAlias

11.description:
A warning threshold for the shares total free space in byte units, like "50GB:"
Please note that this value is decreasing over time, therefor you will have to use the plugin handler and add ":" at the end
of your input to check for "current value < threshold" like in the previous example

Allowed units: B, KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB, PiB
11.caption: WarningTotal

9.description:
A warning threshold for the shares free space in either % or byte units, like "20%:" or "50GB:"
Please note that this value is decreasing over time, therefor you will have to use the plugin handler and add ":" at the end
of your input to check for "current value < threshold" like in the previous example

Allowed units: %, B, KB, MB, GB, TB, PB, KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB, PiB
9.caption: Warning

14.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin. Default to FALSE.
14.caption: NoPerfData

15.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
15.caption: Verbosity

6.description: Provide a username and/or domain to run this check for. The format can either be 'domain\user' or 'domain@user'
6.caption: User

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

13.description: Switches the behaviour of the plugin from checking with threshold for the free space (default) to the remaining (used) space instead
13.caption: CheckUsedSpace
